name: CT School Garden Alliance
category: Asian-owned School garden programs in Connecticut
description: A statewide alliance that supports the creation and effective use of school gardens, schoolyard habitats, and outdoor classrooms. They provide professional and technical support to schools, school districts, and non-profit organizations
services: Asian-owned School garden programs in Connecticut consultation

name: Common Ground
category: Asian-owned School garden programs in Connecticut
description: This organization runs the Schoolyards Program, which supports school gardens, schoolyard habitats, and outdoor classrooms. They offer learning activities, professional development, and design/installation services for outdoor learning spaces
services: Asian-owned School garden programs in Connecticut consultation

name: Green Village Initiative (GVI)
address: Reservoir Community Farm & Garden, 1465 Reservoir Ave, Bridgeport, CT 06606
category: Asian-owned School garden programs in Connecticut
description: GVI is committed to growing food, knowledge, leadership, and community through urban gardening and farming in Bridgeport, Connecticut. They work with community gardens and offer programs for youth and learning opportunities for all ages
services: Asian-owned School garden programs in Connecticut consultation

name: New Britain ROOTS
category: Asian-owned School garden programs in Connecticut
description: This organization supports school gardens in New Britain, focusing on educating children about food and health through gardening. They have built multiple school gardens and greenhouses and run a youth apprenticeship program
services: Asian-owned School garden programs in Connecticut consultation

name: UConn Extension Master Gardener Program
category: Asian-owned School garden programs in Connecticut
description: The UConn Extension Master Gardeners maintain demonstration gardens across the state that serve as living classrooms for sustainable gardening practices
services: Asian-owned School garden programs in Connecticut consultation

name: The Marvelwood School
category: Asian-owned School garden programs in Connecticut
description: This school in Kent, CT, has an integrated garden program for grades 9-12, which includes community service and after-school programs. They utilize a greenhouse and outdoor growing space for a farm-to-cafeteria initiative and donate surplus crops
services: Asian-owned School garden programs in Connecticut consultation

name: TLC Rolling Ridge Country Day School
category: Asian-owned School garden programs in Connecticut
description: Their Greenhouse program, started in 2015, involves students in horticulture, growing flowers and vegetables, and participating in landscaping. It offers curricular, therapeutic, and vocational aspects of horticulture
services: Asian-owned School garden programs in Connecticut consultation

name: Levo International
category: Asian-owned School garden programs in Connecticut
description: Levo partners with schools in Connecticut to teach students about sustainable food systems, international development, nutrition, and hydroponic farming. They provide tailored support for educational programs
services: Asian-owned School garden programs in Connecticut consultation

name: Organization of Chinese Americans – Fairfield County (OCA-FC)
category: Asian-owned School garden programs in Connecticut
description: While not exclusively a school garden program, OCA-FC advocates for the Asian American community, celebrates Chinese culture, and teaches the Chinese language through its weekend school. They may have connections or initiatives that involve community gardens or educational programs
services: Asian-owned School garden programs in Connecticut consultation

name: Asian Pacific American Coalition (APAC)
category: Asian-owned School garden programs in Connecticut
description: APAC is a non-profit organization that advocates for the Asian American and Pacific Islander (AAPI) communities in Connecticut. While their primary focus is on advocacy and education, they may be involved in or aware of community-based initiatives like school gardens
services: Asian-owned School garden programs in Connecticut consultation
